placeholderImages.description: A gentle introduction to Tai Chi.
Building on the fundamentals with more complex forms.
Mastering the flow and energy of advanced Tai Chi.
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and arms hanging loosely at your sides. Slowly raise your arms to shoulder height, palms down, then gently lower them.
A fundamental movement involving warding off, rolling back, pressing, and pushing.
A graceful, expansive posture that opens the body.
A posture that cultivates balance and lightness, mimicking a crane spreading its wings.
A coordinated movement of hand and foot, involving stepping and blocking.
